page.title: 13Recreation
page.content: The area lacks the facilities of the urban areas, but there are still a wide range of leisure activities. Gardening is the favourite activity and this interest is extended in the allotments near the school. Many of the pastimes that the people mentioned, such as knitting, sewing, D.I.Y. cooking, bridge, scrabble, crosswords, painting and craftwork, can be enjoyed within the home. There is ample opportunity for the outdoor activities such as riding, walking, shooting, hunting, ornithology and naturalist interests. In the summer the village fields a cricket team. Activities such as tennis, golf, Inner Wheel and Rotary Clubs, swimming, opera, ballet and the theatre involve travelling to urban areas. There is an active W.I. There are no pubs, but there are two licensed clubs.
